intro: Tithymalus franciscanus, commonly known as the Franciscan tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern California. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to the arid and coastal climates of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
